history.text: Have you seen Batman Begins?
Yes I have. I really liked it.
although Christian Bale had a voice for Batman that seemed over exaggerated, he played the role very well in terms of being the badass Batman and the super aloof, playboy Bruce Wayne
What did you like about the movie?
The movie also had an awesome soundtrack
I thought Christian Bale was great. He did capture the dual nature of Batman/Bruce Wayne well.
I  liked having about Batman's back story.
Hearing, not having
kinda reminded me of Split with James McAvoy. Christian Bale's transition between Batman and Bruce Wayne's characters were seamless
Batman had a pretty traumatic childhood
he watched as his parents were murdered in front of him
And his whole thing about becoming Batman was to bring other people to justice in his own way with his family's wealth and his upbringing
I know, he could have gone either way - super hero or super villain
Do you think you're more of a super hero or a super villian?
I loved that he and Alfred have stayed loyal to each other. Their friendship is kind of a touching part of the movie.
I am more of a hero I guess! I am too much of a softy to be a villain.
Aw yes. I liked the post apocalyptic kinda feel towards the film as well, and the lighting
haha, i feel the same way about being a villian
villian
Do you like a lot of superhero movies?
I suppose. I did really enjoy guardians of the galaxy
Me too, and I liked the Thor movies.
I never really read comics though.
So I don't know anything about DC or Marvel really.
Bruce Wayne falls into a well of sorts and was attacked by a bunch of bats and developed that phobia. I guess he became Batman to fight that fear and have a greater purpose in his anger
Same here about DC and Marvel
I heard that DC has more characters that have more relatable lives
and have more unrealistic heroes
while Marvel is kinda the opposite
The superhero genre is very popular now although it used to be thought of as "nerdy."
New superhero movies are usually the summer blockbusters each year
more elaborate backstories for the person's real life, while having more relatable hero traits
That's very observant of you to notice about when most popular and high grossing movies come out and are being watched
That is one of the reasons I like Batman, because he is a regular person with no super powers, just lots of gadgets and a mission!
Batman got himself arrested while trying to bring a druglord down
He is also portrayed as imperfect and has a troubled past, so in that way he more relatable to many people.
He lets his loved ones know and the people who he trusts, like an honest cop and a corrupt psychaiatrist to try to get the drug lord taken down
Yea the vigilante aspect of his work is an interesting element in the story.
Have you seen the sequels to the movie?
